Title: YAS 67 2017_18 Unified Communications solution to replace current core telephony platform  - AWARD
Description:
YAS 67 2017_18 Unified Communication solution to replace current core telephony platform is only open to Suppliers on Lot 5 or 10 of the CCS Network Services Framework - RM1045. 
      
      This is a joint procurement between the Northern Ambulance Alliance consisting of Yorkshire Ambulance Service (YAS), North West Ambulance Service (NWAS), North East Ambulance Service (NEAS) and East Midlands Ambulance Service (EMAS). Whilst YAS and NWAS requirements are included in the Specification, a catalogue of core contractual items is being requested that can be applied to NEAS & EMAS if required. Both YAS and NWAS are undertaking the procurement directly and will progress jointly until the final recommendation at which point each organisation will follow their respective governance process that will lead to a potential award of Contract. For the avoidance of doubt, both NWAS and YAS will have separate contracts with the successful Supplier, with separate commencement dates.
      
      All correspondence will be made through the In-Tend portal. Please contact Janna Bridgman, Senior Category Manager, Yorkshire Ambulance Service, if you are unable to access In-Tend. Email - janna.bridgman1@nhs.net.

Title: Specialist legal advice for drawing up statutory instrument
Description: The aim of this Contract is for the Supplier to advise government policy officials and legal advisers on legal issues relating to maintaining the coverage of the Crown Guarantee for BTPS members who transfer to the new Openreach; so that officials are able to draft a suitably robust SI. The interaction of the SI with pensions legislation must be taken into account, as well as possible changes to the governance of BT plc and Openreach Limited in the future
